Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module A
Section 1: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease, Including Immunizations

Measures Child Care Providers Should Take When Dealing With Communicable Diseases

Below are some measures that you, as a child care provider, should take when faced with a communicable disease at your site.

Prevent Exposure

Prevent exposure to those that have or are suspected of having the disease. This is when you would bring into place Exclusion, which is discussed later in this section. Licensed Family & Group Homes also need to be aware that if there is anyone living in the home that has a confirmed or suspected case, they are not allowed to be in contact with the children. (R400.1919 for Family & Group Homes)

Contact Local Heath Department

When you know or suspect a Communicable disease, contact your local health department. They can assist you with information to share with the family, provide guidance, and report to the state if warranted.

Notify Parents/Guardians

Once a communicable disease has been identified in your site, you have an obligation to contact all the parents of children at your site.  You should share with them the name of the disease, signs & symptoms to look out for, and recommended prevention measures from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC).CDC Disease Conditions (Center Rule R00.8155)
